<title level="1" right="Focus 4" pfs="Standard">
[Wild Winds Stance](/Spells.aspx?ID=2062)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Air" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=527" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=656" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=701" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 257 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until you leave the stance
</row>

</column>

---

You take on the stance of the flowing winds, sending out waves of energy at a distance. You can make wind crash unarmed Strikes as ranged Strikes against targets within 30 feet. These deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage; are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group; and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=526), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661), [propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=677), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) traits. Wind crash Strikes ignore [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) and all [cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459).

 While in wild winds stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against ranged attacks.
name: Wild Winds Stance
